revised_title: Histamine Regulation of GABA<sub>B</sub> Receptors in the Developing Mammalian CNS
tldr: This study investigates the effects of histamine and neuronal activity on GABA<sub>B</sub> receptors in the developing mammalian central nervous system (CNS). The researchers found that histamine, possibly converted from histidine, reduces the efficacy of GABA<sub>B</sub> agonists. They also discovered that electrical activity can influence receptor properties in the developing CNS.
